metadata.title: WN16-AC-000070 - Windows Server 2016 minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters.
metadata.description: Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network.

metadata.title: WN16-AU-000030 - Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029

metadata.title: WN16-AU-000040 - Permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029

metadata.title: WN16-AU-000050 - Permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029

metadata.title: WN16-AU-000060 - Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.
metadata.description:
Protecting audit information also includes identifying and protecting the tools used to view and manipulate log data. Therefore, protecting audit tools is necessary to prevent unauthorized operation on audit information.
Operating systems providing tools to interface with audit information will leverage user permissions and roles identifying the user accessing the tools and the corresponding rights the user enjoys in order to make access decisions regarding the modification or deletion of audit tools.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000258-GPOS-00099

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000100 - Command line data must be included in process creation events.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Enabling "Include command line data for process creation events" will record the command line information with the process creation events in the log. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000290 - Windows Telemetry must be configured to Security or Basic.
metadata.description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Limiting this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise. The "Security" option for Telemetry configures the lowest amount of data, effectively none outside of the Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT), Defender, and telemetry client settings. "Basic" sends basic diagnostic and usage data and may be required to support some Microsoft services.

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000490 - PowerShell script block logging must be enabled.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Enabling PowerShell script block logging will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.

metadata.title: WN16-DC-000070 - Permissions on the Active Directory data files must only allow System and Administrators access.
metadata.description: Improper access permissions for directory data-related files could allow unauthorized users to read, modify, or delete directory data or audit trails.

metadata.title: WN16-MS-000390 - The "Deny log on as a service" user right on member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems. No other groups or accounts must be assigned this right.
metadata.description:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Deny log on as a service" user right defines accounts that are denied logon as a service.
In an Active Directory Domain, denying logons to the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups on lower-trust systems helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation from credential theft attacks, which could lead to the compromise of an entire domain.
Incorrect configurations could prevent services from starting and result in a denial of service.

metadata.title: WN16-PK-000010 - The DoD Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store.
metadata.description:
To ensure secure DoD websites and DoD-signed code are properly validated, the system must trust the DoD Root Certificate Authorities (CAs). The DoD root certificates will ensure that the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the DoD CAs.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000066-GPOS-00034, SRG-OS-000403-GPOS-00182

metadata.title: WN16-PK-000020 - The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
metadata.description:
To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000066-GPOS-00034, SRG-OS-000403-GPOS-00182

metadata.title: WN16-PK-000030 - The US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
metadata.description:
To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000066-GPOS-00034, SRG-OS-000403-GPOS-00182

metadata.title: WN16-SO-000140 - The machine inactivity limit must be set to 15 minutes, locking the system with the screen saver.
metadata.description: Unattended systems are susceptible to unauthorized use and should be locked when unattended. The screen saver should be set at a maximum of 15 minutes and be password protected. This protects critical and sensitive data from exposure to unauthorized personnel with physical access to the computer.

metadata.title: WN16-UR-000280 - The Perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
metadata.description:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Perform volume maintenance tasks" user right can manage volume and disk configurations. This could be used to delete volumes, resulting in data loss or a denial of service.

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000555 - Windows Server 2016 must have PowerShell Transcription enabled.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Enabling PowerShell Transcription will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled and ready for use.
metadata.description: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to protect data that could be used in credential theft attacks if compromised. A number of system requirements must be met in order for Credential Guard to be configured and enabled properly. Without a TPM enabled and ready for use, Credential Guard keys are stored in a less secure method using software.

criterion.comment: Windows Server domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled and ready for use.
Windows Server TPM Specific Version should be 1.2 or 2.0

metadata.title: Permissions for the system drive root directory (usually C:\) must conform to minimum requirements.
metadata.description: Permissions for the system drive root directory (usually C:\) must conform to minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users is set to 'Disabled'
Permissions must conform to minimum requirements for system drive root directory.

metadata.description: Permissions for program file directories must conform to minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users is set to 'Disabled'
Permissions must conform to minimum requirements for Program Files directory.
Permissions must conform to minimum requirements for Program Files (x86) directory.

metadata.title: Permissions for the Windows installation directory must conform to minimum requirements.
metadata.description: Permissions for the Windows installation directory must conform to minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users is set to 'Disabled'

The system is not a domain controller
Default non-Domain Controler permissions for the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM registry hive must be maintained.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 accounts must require passwords.
metadata.description: The lack of password protection enables anyone to gain access to the information system, which opens a backdoor opportunity for intruders to compromise the system as well as other resources. Accounts on a system must require passwords.

criterion.comment: Windows Server - Accounts must require passwords.
The system is a Windows Standalone Server or a Windows Domain Member Server
Windows Domain Controller - Accounts must require passwords.
The system is a Windows Domain Controller

metadata.title: Passwords must be configured to expire.
metadata.description: Passwords that do not expire or are reused increase the exposure of a password with greater probability of being discovered or cracked.

criterion.comment: Windows Server - Local account passwords must be configured to expire.
The system is a Windows Standalone Server or a Windows Domain Member Server
Windows Domain Controller - Account passwords must be configured to expire.
The system is a Windows Domain Controller

metadata.title: Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows Server 2016.
metadata.description: Windows Server 2016 must have software certificate installation files removed.

criterion.comment: Software certificate installation files must be removed. Remove .p12 files
Software certificate installation files must be removed. Remove .pfx files.

metadata.title: FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.
metadata.description:
The FTP service allows remote users to access shared files and directories. Allowing anonymous FTP connections makes user auditing difficult.
Using accounts that have administrator privileges to log on to FTP risks that the userid and password will be captured on the network and give administrator access to an unauthorized user.

criterion.comment: FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.

metadata.title: FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive.
metadata.description:
If FTP is not installed on the system, this is NA.
Open "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".
Select "Sites" under the server name.
For any sites with a Binding that lists FTP, right-click the site and select "Explore".
If the site is not defined to a specific folder for shared FTP resources, this is a finding.
If the site includes any system areas such as root of the drive, Program Files, or Windows directories, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Windows Server 2016 FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive. If the site includes root of the drive this is a finding.
Windows Server 2016 FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive. If the site includes Program Files this is a finding.
Windows Server 2016 FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive. If the site includes Program Files(x86) this is a finding.
Windows Server 2016 FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive. If the site includes Windows Directory this is a finding.

metadata.title: The time service must synchronize with an appropriate DoD time source.

criterion.comment: The Windows 2016 time service must synchronize with an appropriate DoD time source.

metadata.title: Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 2016.
metadata.description: Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 2016.

criterion.comment: Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 11.

metadata.title: Secure Boot must be enabled on Windows Server 2016 systems.
metadata.description: Secure Boot is a standard that ensures systems boot only to a trusted operating system. Secure Boot is required to support additional security features in Windows Server 2016, including Virtualization Based Security and Credential Guard. If Secure Boot is turned off, these security features will not function.

criterion.comment: Secure Boot must be enabled on Windows Server 2016 systems.

metadata.title: Windows 2016 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.
metadata.description: UEFI provides additional security features in comparison to legacy BIOS firmware, including Secure Boot. UEFI is required to support additional security features in Windows Server 2016, including Virtualization Based Security and Credential Guard. Systems with UEFI that are operating in "Legacy BIOS" mode will not support these security features.

criterion.comment: Windows 2016 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Plug and Play activity records events related to the successful connection of external devices.

criterion.comment: Security Option Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled.
Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit Group Membership records information related to the group membership of a user's logon token.

criterion.comment: Security Option Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled.
Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage successes.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Removable Storage auditing under Object Access records events related to access attempts on file system objects on removable storage devices.

criterion.comment: Security Option Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled.
The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage successes.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures.
metadata.description:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Removable Storage auditing under Object Access records events related to access attempts on file system objects on removable storage devices.

criterion.comment: Security Option Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled.
The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 virtualization-based security must be enabled with the platform security level configured to Secure Boot or Secure Boot with DMA Protection.
metadata.description: Virtualization-based security (VBS) provides the platform for the additional security features Credential Guard and virtualization-based protection of code integrity. Secure Boot is the minimum security level, with DMA protection providing additional memory protection. DMA Protection requires a CPU that supports input/output memory management unit (IOMMU).

criterion.comment: Windows Server virtualization-based security must be enabled with the platform security level configured to Secure Boot or Secure Boot with DMA Protection. RequiredSecurityProperties
Windows Server virtualization-based security must be enabled with the platform security level configured to Secure Boot or Secure Boot with DMA Protection. VirtualizationBasedSecurityStatus

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Computer Account Management successes.
metadata.description: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Computer Account Management successes.

criterion.comment: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Computer Account Management successes.

metadata.title: Active Directory user accounts, including administrators, must be configured to require the use of a Common Access Card (CAC), Personal Identity Verification (PIV)-compliant hardware token, or Alternate Logon Token (ALT) for user authentication.
metadata.description: Active Directory user accounts, including administrators, must be configured to require the use of a Common Access Card (CAC), Personal Identity Verification (PIV)-compliant hardware token, or Alternate Logon Token (ALT) for user authentication.

criterion.comment: Active Directory user accounts, including administrators, must be configured to require the use of a Common Access Card (CAC), Personal Identity Verification (PIV)-compliant hardware token, or Alternate Logon Token (ALT) for user authentication.

metadata.title: The password for the krbtgt account on a domain must be reset at least every 180 days.
metadata.description:
The krbtgt account acts as a service account for the Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC) service. The account and password are created when a domain is created and the password is typically not changed. If the krbtgt account is compromised, attackers can create valid Kerberos Ticket Granting Tickets (TGT).
The password must be changed twice to effectively remove the password history.Changing once, waiting for replication to complete and the amount of time equal to or greater than the maximum Kerberos ticket lifetime, and changing again reduces the risk of issues.

criterion.comment: The password for the krbtgt account on a domain must be reset at least every 180 days.

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be running Credential Guard on domain-joined member servers.
metadata.description: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to protect data that could be used in credential theft attacks if compromised. This authentication information, which was stored in the Local Security Authority (LSA) in previous versions of Windows, is isolated from the rest of the operating system and can only be accessed by privileged system software.

criterion.comment: Windows Server 2016 must be running Credential Guard on domain-joined member servers.

metadata.title: The required legal notice must be configured to display before console logon.
metadata.description:
Failure to display the logon banner prior to a logon attempt will negate legal proceedings resulting from unauthorized access to system resources.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000023-GPOS-00006, SRG-OS-000024-GPOS-00007, SRG-OS-000228-GPOS-00088

criterion.comment: The Windows dialog box title for the legal banner must be configured with the appropriate text.
The Windows dialog box title for the legal banner must be configured with the appropriate text.

metadata.title: Anonymous SID/Name translation must not be allowed.
metadata.description: Allowing anonymous SID/Name translation can provide sensitive information for accessing a system. Only authorized users must be able to perform such translations.

criterion.comment: Anonymous SID/Name translation must not be allowed.

metadata.title: Zone information must be preserved when saving attachments.
metadata.description: Attachments from outside sources may contain malicious code. Preserving zone of origin (Internet, intranet, local, restricted) information on file attachments allows Windows to determine risk.

criterion.comment: Zone information must be preserved when saving attachments. SaveZoneInformation must be set to 2 if value exists.

metadata.title: The Windows Explorer Preview pane must be disabled for Windows Server 2016.
metadata.description:
A known vulnerability in Windows could allow the execution of malicious code by either opening a compromised document or viewing it in the Windows Preview pane.
Organizations must disable the Windows Preview pane and Windows Detail pane.

criterion.comment: The Windows Explorer Preview pane must be disabled for Windows Server 2016. NoPreviewPane must be equal to 1
The Windows Explorer Preview pane must be disabled for Windows Server 2016. NoReadingPane must be equal to 1

independent-def:shellcommand_object.comment: Powershell command to get built-in admin password age (AD)
independent-def:shellcommand_object.independent-def:command: try{$user = Get-ADUser -Filter * -Properties SID, PasswordLastSet | Where SID -Like '*-500'; ([datetime]::Now - $user.PasswordLastSet).Days} catch {[Console]::Error.WriteLine('Get-ADUser cmdlet is not available on this system.')}

independent-def:shellcommand_object.comment: Powershell command to get built-in admin password age (local)
Run Icacls command against system drive root directory
Run Icacls command against Program Files directory
Run Icacls command against Program Files (x86) directory
Run Icacls command against Windows install directory
Gather permissions for the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SECURITY registry
independent-def:shellcommand_object.independent-def:command: ([Microsoft.Win32.Registry]::LocalMachine.OpenSubKey("Security", [System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights]::ReadPermissions)).GetAccessControl().Access | Where-Object { $_.RegistryRights -notmatch '\d+' } | ForEach-Object { "Identity:$($_.IdentityReference), Rights: $($_.RegistryRights), Access: $($_.AccessControlType), IsInherited: $($_.IsInherited), InheritanceFlags: $($_.InheritanceFlags), PropagationFlags: $($_.PropagationFlags)" }

independent-def:shellcommand_object.comment: Gather permissions for the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE registry
